alert.note: Alert for Phelps; Pulaski; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 10:03AM CDT until May 21 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Maries and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent and Texas. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1003 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Piney Creek at Highway H, Smoky Hollow at Highway J, Norman Creek at County Road 4220, Montague Creek at County Road 510 and Dry Fork at County Road 407. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rolla, St. James, Belle, Doolittle, Vienna, Newburg, Edgar Springs and Northwye. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
